definitions.definition: an act of giving one thing and receiving another (especially of the same type or value) in return.
examples: negotiations should eventually lead to an exchange of land for peace

definitions.definition: a visit or visits in which two people or groups from different countries stay with each other or do each other's jobs.
examples: nine colleagues were away on an exchange visit to Germany

definitions.definition: the giving of money for its equivalent in the money of another country.
the fee or percentage charged for converting the currency of one country into that of another.
a system or market in which commercial transactions involving currency, shares, commodities, etc., can be carried out within or between countries. See also foreign exchange.
a central office or station of operations providing telephone service.
examples: private branch exchanges to automate internal telephone networks

definitions.definition: a move or short sequence of moves in which both players capture material of comparable value, or particularly the exchange in which one captures a rook in return for a knight or bishop (and is said to win the exchange ).
a building or institution used for the trading of a particular commodity or commodities.
synonyms: money market; bourse "a broker on the exchange"

definitions.definition: give something and receive something of the same kind in return.
give or receive one thing in place of another.
examples: we regret that tickets cannot be exchanged
